items.sentence: Tom accidentally deleted all the files on one of his external hard disks.
I think Tom is likely to be very hungry by the time he gets home tonight.
Tom always listens to the news on the radio while he\'s eating breakfast.
Tom always makes a point of arriving at least five minutes ahead of time.
Tom and Mary are planning on going to a movie together on Friday evening.
I wonder whether or not Tom has already told Mary she shouldn\'t do that.
The police were at Tom\'s door within three minutes after the phone call.
My grandmother used to use her sewing machine a lot when she was younger.
By the way, did you find the umbrella you said you\'d lost the other day?
Tom was three years old when his mother was killed in a traffic accident.
Tom says he doesn\'t know who Mary is planning on going to the prom with.
Tom couldn\'t go to college because his family didn\'t have enough money.
Tom couldn\'t believe that Mary didn\'t want to go to the dance with him.
Tom doesn\'t always get up early, but he always gets up before Mary does.
Tom doesn\'t need any more soap. Mary gave him enough to last a lifetime.
Tom wanted to help Mary rake the leaves, but she was using the only rake.
When I was younger I could remember anything, whether it happened or not.
I haven\'t used French in a long time and I\'ve forgotten a lot of words.
At first, Tom thought French was difficult, but now he thinks it\'s easy.
Did you really think I wouldn\'t find out that you went there last night?
